intro: Amyema longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf amyema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release seeds when mature. Amyema longifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
